Title: Senior Data Engineer-Tolls Team
Description: * Connected Vehicle Optimization (CVO) is a Software as a Service (SaaS) and technology solutions company in the transportation industry and the leader in the trucking weigh station, toll bypass, and software space. Now more than ever, we are proud to be a part of helping transportation companies get critically needed goods to their destination as timely and safely as possible. We help states and transportation companies reduce traffic, fuel usage, safety risk, and pollution while increasing productivity! CVO, with 300+ employees (and growing), was recently spun out of a 6-Billion-dollar company, and for the first time in its nearly 25-year history, will be its standalone organization! You will get the best of both worlds, with all the fun and feel of a fast-paced startup, and the benefits of a financially secure and established organization. Apply today to join the excitement of building a SaaS company, and get in on the ground floor where you can help shape the direction of our department and company!* Position Summary: * We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer, you will be a member of a data-centric development team responsible for developing pipelines for data ingestion, processing, and distribution. You will be challenged with identifying innovative solutions to meet the needs of our growing business. One of the major duties of this position is to help drive the transformation of a legacy data integration platform to a contemporary cloud-native solution. The ideal candidate would be excited by data infrastructure and processes with a familiarity working in cloud environments. This position, in a highly relevant and in-demand industry, reports to our Software Engineering Manager and can be fully remote, or a hybrid role that will have the flexibility to work a combination at home and in the office, a brand-new gorgeous space in the most sought-after area of downtown Phoenix, Block 23 at Cityscape.* What We Want You to Do: * Partner with team to design and implement a strategy for re-architecting legacy SQL Server Integration Services [SSIS].*  Develop and manage production ETL pipelines.*  Formulate complex SQL queries for transforming and collating data across multiple sources.*  Troubleshoot data integration and data quality issues, diagnose failures, implement optimal solutions, and revise procedures.*  Develop and implement Azure cloud services such as Functions, Logic Apps, and Service Bus.*  Design systems with scalability, maintainability, and testability in mind.*  Develop comprehensive solutions for logging, error reporting and alerting.*  Participate in proof-of-concept exercises and prototyping. Provide analysis and recommendations based on your findings.* Who You Are: * Required* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience.*  Minimum 5 years of overall experience in designing and building large scale database solutions.*  Expert T-SQL development skills including query optimization and stored procedures.*  Experience creating and maintaining ETL processes and architecting complex data pipelines.*  Proficient knowledge and experience with .Net framework, C#.*  Committed to delivering on value-added innovation.*  Eager to learn and experiment with new technology.*  Full COVID-19 Vaccination required.* Preferred* Experience in Azure Cloud and ETL cloud tooling.*  Familiarity of event driven architecture – queues, batches, and pub/sub models.*  Experience working with data from enterprise systems like ERPs and CRMs.*  Familiarity with DevOps CI/CD implementation methodologies.* Additional Reasons this Job is Amazing: * Free health insurance option.*  Great benefit package with medical, dental, and vision that start on date of hire.*  Flexible work schedule.*  401 (k) plan with strong employer match.*  No travel expected.*  Work environment where you have a lot of independence.*  Growth opportunities.*  Tuition Reimbursement Plan.*  Professional Certification Support and Professional Development to include: Certification Reimbursement Program, Internal Advancement Opportunities, Skills‐Based Training through Pluralsight, Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise Subscription (MSDN Ultimate) that includes perks for you (i.e., access to all of Microsoft software, and $150 worth of credits for Microsoft Azure/month).*  Centrally located in gorgeous downtown Phoenix; our brand‐new office space was designed to create an employee centric safe work environment!*  Ability to work with a purpose and make an impact on our planet.* Job Type: Full-time* Benefits:* 401(k)*  401(k) matching*  Dental insurance*  Employee assistance program*  Employee discount*  Flexible schedule*  Flexible spending account*  Health insurance*  Health savings account*  Life insurance*  Paid time off*  Professional development assistance*  Tuition reimbursement*  Vision insurance* Schedule:* Monday to Friday* COVID-19 considerations:COVID-19 vaccination requirement* Application Question(s):* CVO is currently hiring only persons who are either fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or who will either have received one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or the second dose of either the Pfizer or Moderna COVID-19 vaccine as of their start date, subject to any need for accommodation due to legitimate disability or religious objection. With that being said, can we proceed?* Education:* Bachelor's (Required)* Experience:* designing and building large scale database solutions: 4 years (Required)* Work Location: Multiple Locations*

Title: Data Analyst
Description: As a remote work organization, Enveyo hires top talent from around the nation to create a team of talented individuals who help leading organizations transform their supply chain operations.*Basic Function*We’re seeking a Data Analyst to join our industry-leading team. This individual will work with all functions and individuals in the organization and interact directly with the customers. The Data Analyst will spend 70% of their time focused on external customers and 30% on internal efforts. The Data Analyst will conduct full lifecycle analysis for use within the organization and for external customers. Utilizing the organization’s proprietary system, the Data Analyst will provide reports to customers, assist customers in analyzing data, and using the data to inform business decisions. Additionally, the analysis and models produced by the Data Analyst will be used to inform decisions to improve our software products, inform internal teams, and deepen and enhance relationships with customers. The Data Analyst will work closely with the Customer Management Team to support customer acquisition and retention.*Key Responsibilities*Process and analyze data from the proprietary database; identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to inform data driven business decisions*Interpret data, analyze results using a variety of methods and provide ongoing and ad-hoc reports*Prepare reports for executive leadership that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data*Filter and “clean” data from unstructured data sources (flat files, databases, etc.) leveraging different languages such as R, Python, etc. as well as querying the database directly using MySQL*Collaborate with software engineers and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend system modifications*Provide quality assurance of imported data*Support and lead initiatives for data integrity and normalization*Manage and design the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata*Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis if necessary*Work directly with customers to generate reports, analyze data and assist customers in understanding the data to make business decisions*Implement data governance strategies and architect data solutions with customers*Troubleshooting report performance, report discrepancies.*Training end users on new reports and dashboards*Candidate Attributes & Skills*Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy – able to tell story with data and answer “so what”*Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings*Strong customer service skills; able to present information that is actionable and can be understood by a wide variety of audiences*High-level written and verbal communication skills*Ability to think critically and solve customer problems*High attention to detail and maniacally focused on perfection and ensuring that data used to generate reports for use as business tools is 100% correct*Demonstrated experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases/data sets*Experience & Education*5 years of experience as a data analyst in a remote work environment preferably in the parcel/shipping industry and/or supply chain*Experience with reporting software and databases (MySQL, Excel, MS Access, etc.)*Programming experience with a language such as Python, R, ETL frameworks is a bonus*Technical expertise regarding data models, querying databases, big data management, data mining and segmentation techniques*BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or Statistics, Data sciences or other degrees focused on data*What Enveyo Offers*Competitive salary*Flexible schedule + 100% remote work opportunity*Bonus potential, profit sharing, 401k*Every team member enjoys one week off in July and one week off in December (in addition to vacation)*Excellent health benefits

Title: Software & Development Operations Engineer
Description: As a remote work organization, Enveyo hires top talent from around the nation to create a team of talented individuals who help leading organizations transform their supply chain operations.*Basic Function*As a member of this small, fast-paced, agile software development team focused on achieving results, the Software & Development Operations Engineer will work directly with the CTO/Co-Founder of the organization and receive daily direction from the team lead. This team is focused on developing and improving high quality, enterprise solutions for our clients. Individuals in this role will spend about 40% of their time on the Development Operations work focused on deployment of infrastructure stacks, monitoring and metrics tooling, standards and processes, and utilize cloud resources. 60% of this individual’s time will be spent as a Software Engineer focused on product infrastructure development, new feature development, and software issue resolution. Individuals in this role will have the unique opportunity to drive the direction of the product for the organization. As a remote employee in an organization adept at managing a remote workforce, individuals in these roles will have full responsibility for managing their time and work with a high degree of flexibility to enhance and improve the product.*Key Responsibilities*Enable infrastructure to achieve a high level of reliability*Build tools that streamline development and deployment of infrastructure stacks*Build and scale out our monitoring and metrics tooling, standards, and processes, to facilitate data-informed decision making*Optimize the utilization of cloud resources to balance performance and cost*Perform deep dives on complex technical issues across networks, ranging from automated tooling to hardware failures and network issues*Anticipate potential operational risks and develop strategies to mitigate/minimize*Keeping our services running and recovering quickly when failure occurs*Automating work including infrastructure needs, testing, failover solutions, failure mitigation*Ability to execute network assessments and report results*Review and development of performance and capacity plans (operational capacity and load requirements)*Experience with application disaster recovery, migration, roll-back plans, expansion, routine deployments, and system upgrade*Knowledge of network switches, firewalls, and routers*Expert in system integration, ongoing data validation processes, quality assurance, delivery, operations, and sustainability of technical solutions*Develop and deploy high-volume distributed and scalable applications in Java while maintaining the project schedule*Conceptualize, design, develop, debug, and provide effort estimation and risk analysis of a project/feature/service*Participate in the design, provide input into architectural decisions, and standardization efforts influencing product or service*Work closely with Product Management to define Requirements*Take end-to-end ownership of the development of products and services service, while coordinate with internal and external teams/stakeholders as appropriate*Translate high-level requirements to actionable tasks/deliverables*Work multi-functionally with various teams including site reliability engineers, project managers, and product managers*Candidate Attributes & Skills*The successful candidate will be a results-oriented, high-performing technologist with a strong desire to deepen their own expertise and be part of a fast growing, software product company.*Experience working with agile development methods*Working knowledge of distributed computing principles*Working knowledge of software engineering standard methodologies (e.g., code reviews, unit testing, integration testing, design documentation)*Willing to work fast without compromising on the quality of the work; comfortable taking risks, making mistakes and learning from mistakes*Strong ability to “dig-in,” investigate, research, and read code to solve problems, develop features and enhancements and comfortable asking questions and working with others to solve issues*Experience in building and managing complex and highly scalable/available systems*Experienced with configuration and infrastructure as code, heavy automation first mentality*Experience in deploying, operating, and managing customer-facing services in cloud platforms*Knowledge of infrastructure monitoring, from service availability and health, to capacity usage and cost*Experience & Education*A minimum of 2-3 years of web application development and 2-3 years of development operations experience working in a remote work environment preferably in the parcel/shipping industry and/or supply chain*Experience deploying in the AWS ecosystem of offerings (EC2, RDS, ECS, IAM, etc.)*Preference given to those with experience working with big data and development principles around data sciences*Practical experience writing in Java, Gradle, Spring Boot, JavaScript, jQuery, JavaScript, front end JavaScript frameworks (Angular, React, vue, etc.)*Strong Experience in Web Development (Full Stack Development)*Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related discipline required; masters preferred*Must be legally authorized to work in the US.*What Enveyo Offers*Competitive salary*Flexible schedule + 100% remote work opportunity*Bonus potential, profit sharing, 401k*Every team member enjoys one week off in July and one week off in December (in addition to vacation)*Excellent health benefits

Title: Software Engineer - Java
Description: As a remote work organization, Enveyo hires top talent from around the nation to create a team of talented individuals who help leading organizations transform their supply chain operations.*Basic Function*As a member of this small, fast-paced, agile software development team focused on achieving results, the Software Engineers will work directly with the CTO/Co-Founder of the organization and receive daily direction from the team lead. This team is focused on developing and improving high quality, enterprise solutions for our clients. Individuals in this role will work on a suite of products and will spend their time as follows – product infrastructure development (20%), new feature development (45%), and software issue resolution (35%). Individuals in this role will have the unique opportunity to drive the direction of the product for the organization. As a remote employee in an organization adept at managing a remote workforce, individuals in these roles will have full responsibility for managing their time and work with a high degree of flexibility to enhance and improve the product.*Key Responsibilities*Develop and deploy high-volume distributed and scalable applications in Java while maintaining the project schedule*Conceptualize, design, develop, debug, and provide effort estimation and risk analysis of a project/feature/service*Participate in the design, provide input into architectural decisions, and standardization efforts influencing product or service*Work closely with Product Management to define requirements*Take end-to-end ownership of the development of products and services service, while coordinate with internal and external teams/stakeholders as appropriate*Translate high level requirements to actionable tasks/deliverables*Work multi-functionally with various teams including site reliability engineers, project managers, product managers*Candidate Attributes & Skills*The successful candidate will be a results-oriented, high-performing technologist with a strong desire to deepen their own expertise and be part of a fast growing, software product company.*Experience working with agile development methods*Working knowledge of distributed computing principles*Working knowledge of software engineering standard methodologies (e.g., code reviews, unit testing, integration testing, design documentation)*Willing to work fast without compromising on the quality of the work; comfortable taking risks, making mistakes, and learning from mistakes*Strong ability to “dig-in,” investigate, research, and read code to solve problems, develop features and enhancements and comfortable asking questions and working with others to solve issues*Experience & Education*A minimum of 5 years of web application development work in a remote work environment preferably in the parcel/shipping industry and/or supply chain*Preference given to those with experience working with big data and development principles around data sciences or front-end web-development experience*Practical experience writing in Java, Grails, Spring Boot, JavaScript, jQuery, JavaScript, front end JavaScript frameworks (Angular, React, Vue, etc.)*Strong Experience in Web Development (Full Stack Development)*Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related discipline required; Master’s preferred*Must be legally authorized to work in the US*What Enveyo Offers*Competitive salary*Flexible schedule + 100% remote work opportunity*Bonus potential, profit sharing, 401k*Every team member enjoys one week off in July and one week off in December (in addition to vacation)*Excellent health benefits

Title: Remote - Cloud Database Architect
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT 84111
Description: * *  Company Summary*  *   Join a team that puts its People First! Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for six consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.*  *   Job Summary*  *   Seeking an experienced Cloud Data Architect to contribute to Eclipse microservices-based application. The ideal candidate is a professional with experience in designing, developing, migrating, validating and communicating enterprise-wide data solutions using modern tools and cloud technologies such as AWS*  *   Responsibilities*   Design and develop enterprise-wide database solution in a micro-system environment utilizing AWS cloud technologies and/or MS SQL Server*    Assist in designing multi-phased cloud data strategies including crafting multi-phased implementation roadmaps*    Design and implement scalable cloud microservices database migrations strategy and the microservices adoption process within the organization to solve complex business solutions*    Architect, integrate and configure applications to fully utilize Microsoft SQL Server and Cloud native databases technologies that support complex, highly available, and resilient database systems*    Serve as a subject matter expert in a cloud platform; research, analyze, recommend and select technical approaches for solving exciting, complex development and integration problems*    Monitor database efficiency, ensure high availability, and maintains database performance by troubleshooting problems, fine tune the database environments and perform capacity planning*    Implement and maintains cloud database environments, troubleshoot and resolve database performance issues*    Provide technical expertise and hands-on support in consolidation and migration of databases to new platforms*    Involved in designing and deploying end to end solutions with a cloud platform’s analytic services*   Qualifications*   Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or related discipline*    8+ years of data engineering and/or data warehousing experience*    5+ years of deep experience building cloud data solutions (AWS or equivalent cloud)*    Experience with cloud database technologies, data ingestion, data storage, real-time processing and analytics*    Hands on experience leading large-scale data related and/or database projects.*    Working experience with version control platforms e.g., Git*    Excellent problem solving, collaboration, and communication skills*    Team player and the ability to work effectively within a group as well as self-motivated with minimal supervision*    Strong communication skills and a working knowledge of agile development, including DevOps concepts*    Familiarity with the technology stack available in the industry for metadata management: Data Governance, Data Quality, Lineage, Data Catalog etc*  *   #techreferral*   #LI-JC2*   #TCORPIT*  *   First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.*  *   Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.* *

Title: Senior Production Engineer
Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84180 (Downtown area)+3 locations
Description: Overview*Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public and commercial markets with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. We help clients address their toughest challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures with a focus on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that prepare our clients for future growth and success. The company has more than 10,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit: www.guidehouse.com.Responsibilities*This position is for the AFNWC ICBM Directorate ISC 2.0 project.Senior level production-engineering services AND technical leadership of engineering teamPerforms a variety of engineering analysis tasks which are broad in nature and are concerned with the design and implementation, including personnel, hardware, software and support facilities and/or equipmentPerforms with some latitude for un-reviewed actions and decisionsPlans and performs analysis of engineering research, design development, and other assignments in conformance with design, engineering and customer specificationsResponsible for the technical/analysis/engineering part of a major project with complexity and importanceCoordinates the activities of Technicians assigned to specific analysis/engineering projectsMay perform other duties as assignedQualifications*Minimum SECRET security clearance.Required:BS Degree in any engineering discipline + 10 years of related engineering experience ORBS Degree in any engineering discipline AND MS Degree in any engineering discipline + 7 years of related engineering experience ORBS and/or MS Degree in an engineering discipline AND PhD Degree in any engineering discipline + 4 years of related engineering experienceSystems Engineering Experience and/or Certification*Professional Engineering License desired3+ yrs of progressive responsibility in providing technical leadershipSenior skill set includes ability to perform all stated/implied duties within this tier and those reasonably derived from preceding tier*Desired:*ICBM experience desired*TS clearance desired*Contractor shall obtain and maintain certificaitons as required by current versions of AFMAN 17-1303, DoDi 8570.01-M and other applicable lasw and regulations.Additional Requirements*The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.*Due to our contractual requirements and an Executive Order from the White House, every federal government employee and onsite federal contractor will be asked to attest to their vaccination status. In the interest of health and safety during the continued unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic, anyone who does not attest to being fully vaccinated will be required to follow CDC guidelines which may include (subject to specific contractual requirements): wearing a mask on the job no matter their geographic location, physically distancing from all other employees and visitors, complying to any screening testing requirements. This requirement will apply to Guidehouse employees who work onsite for the federal government.*Due to our contractual requirements, to be eligible for this role, you must be fully COVID-19 vaccinated at time of hireDisclaimer*About Guidehouse*Guidehouse is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.*Guidehouse will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.*If you have visited our website for information about employment opportunities, or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Guidehouse Recruiting at 1-571-633-1711 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@guidehouse.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodation.*Guidehouse does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Guidehouse and Guidehouse will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.*Rewards and Benefits*Guidehouse offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflects our commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.*Benefits include:*Medical, Rx, Dental & Vision Insurance*Personal and Family Sick Time & Company Paid Holidays*Position may be eligible for a discretionary variable incentive bonus*Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance*401(k) Retirement Plan*Basic Life & Supplemental Life*Health Savings Account, Dental/Vision & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts*Short-Term & Long-Term Disability*Tuition Reimbursement, Personal Development & Learning Opportunities*Skills Development & Certifications*Employee Referral Program*Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach*Emergency Back-Up Childcare Program

Title: Senior Nuclear Hardness Engineer

Parameters for subsystem modifications, and weapon system capabilities.*Supports EMI/EMC activities as needed and/or dictated by the Principal Nuclear Hardness Engineer.Qualifications*Minimum SECRET security clearance.*There is a position: Principal level with educational and experience requirements as follows:*Journeyman: BA or BS degree in STEM-related field + 4 years of experience OR MS degree + 2 years of experience OR PHD + 1 year of experience***This position is intended for individuals with prior education/experience in the fields of electrical, mechanical, computer, software or nuclear engineering as well as advanced electronics.*DESIRED:*ICBM experience desired*TS clearance desired*Acquisition knowledge/background preferredAdditional Requirements*The successful candidate must not Guidehouse*Guidehouse is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Title: Senior Quality Analyst Engineer
Description: * *  Job Description: *  *  *   Employer: SelectHealth, Inc. *   Job Title: Senior Quality Analyst Engineer *   Degree Required: Master’s degree or equivalent foreign education *   Academic Discipline(s): Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science *   Experience Required: Two years of experience *   Alternate Occupation(s) *   Accepted: Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science *   *   OR *   *   Degree Required: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent foreign education *   Academic Discipline(s): Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science *   Experience Required: Six years of post-degree progressive experience *   Alternate Occupation(s) *   Accepted: Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science *   *   Job Description: *   *   As a Senior Quality Analyst Engineer at SelectHealth, Inc. you will be responsible to ensure software quality through testing software/software platforms for specific business needs, including: enhancements, maintenance, and defect fixes. This role requires a senior-level professional experienced in all aspects of quality assurance and testing. Encompasses full knowledge required within the quality and software development lifecycle. Typically designs and develops approaches that are implemented by others. Functions with minimal oversight and direction. Provides technical guidance to peers. *   *   Additional responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following: *   Creates and maintains test plans and individual test cases using approved standards, processes, and tools for common and complex projects. *    Evaluates level of risk in determining the scope and coverage of the individual test plan(s). *    Executes test cases and accurately documents defects using approved standards, processes, and tools for common and complex projects. *    Collaborates in requirements development and/or review. *    Reports results and recommends to key business stakeholders/groups on the quality of the product, software development lifecycle processes, and the risk of promoting for production use for common and complex projects. *    Participates in the creation and management of project plans. *    Consistently meets agreed upon deadlines or escalates issues, concerns and barriers to key project leaders. *    Assists in the prioritization of tasks/assignments. *    Investigates and assists in the resolution of common and complex issues, incidents, and problems. *    Collaboratively works with peers, internal and external stakeholders, and vendors. *    With minimal oversight, develops training and knowledge-based materials for use by peers and other IS team members. *    Creates and maintains complex database queries. *    Creates and maintains automation scripts for complex projects. *    Participates in the design and creation of test harnesses, automation and performance testing frameworks. *   Minimum Title: Database Administrator-Staff
Description: * *  Job Description: The Database Administrator performs administration and provides operational support for corporate databases including backup, recovery, system availability, performance tuning, installation, security, and troubleshooting. Staff-level professional experienced in all aspects of database administration. Encompasses full knowledge required within the database area. Functions independently with minimal oversight and direction. May instruct and guide other technical professionals. *   Remote/hybrid work - we may hire out of state workers where state laws allow. *  *  Job Essentials  1. Assists customers and management in setting strategy for current and future architecture related to databases.  2. Mentors other team members to increase their skill and knowledge.  3. Manages small to medium projects as needed.  4. Assists in creating and adopting quality initiatives to improve processes and increase efficiencies.  5. Provides solutions to issues in areas related to databases.  6. Identifies and initiates changes that continually improve a positive open team environment.  7. Assists in the design and implementation of redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets.  8. Assists in the research and makes recommendations on database products in support of procurement and development efforts.  9. Works with application development and Database Administration staff to develop database architectures, coding standards, and quality assurance policies and procedures.  10. Monitors database system details within the database, and implement efficiency improvements.  11. Assists in the creation of standards and processes for developers to facilitate best practices for database use.  Note: Individual is at the first level of certification within two years of a new technology release in their field or one year after their hire date  Minimum Qualifications  Three years of database experience, or any combination of equivalent education and experience.  - and -  Bachelor's degree in computer science or Information Systems. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.  - or -  Four years of equivalent technical experience in database administration or related technical field.  - and -  Working technical knowledge of database administration including hands-on troubleshooting experience.  - and -  Working technical knowledge of current database hardware, protocols, and standards.  Preferred Qualifications  ITIL certification.  Analytical and problem-solving abilities.  - and -  Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.  - and -  Ability to lead small to medium projects.  - and -  Strong written and oral communication skills.  - and -  Good interpersonal skills.  - and -  Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.  - and -  Self motivated and directed.  - and -  Keen attention to detail.  - and -  Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.  - and -  Strong customer service orientation.  - and -  Experience in a healthcare environment.  - and -  Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws. *  *  #LI-EXECRC*  *  Physical Requirements: *  Interact with others requiring the employee to communicate information.  - and -  Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands.  - and -  See and read computer monitors and documents.  - and -  Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment. *  *  Location: SelectHealth - Murray *  *  Work City: Murray *  *  Work State: Utah *  *  Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40* *

Title: Cybersecurity Technical Manager (Remote)
Description: * *  WHO WE ARE *  Supported by more than 3,000 employees in nearly 100 locations across the United States, we provide a full continuum of engineering and consulting services, including design, planning, architectural, environmental, construction and program management. Our clients include U.S. federal, state and municipal governments, foreign allied governments, and a wide range of commercial clients. Michael Baker is committed to delivering a standard of excellence that fosters a culture of innovation, collaboration and technological advancement to help solve our clients' complex challenges. To learn more, visit https://mbakerintl.com/ . *  ARCHITECTURE & BUILDING ENGINEERING PRACTICE *  Michael Baker International seamlessly integrates all our service offerings – architecture, planning, landscape architecture, engineering and management – to solve client challenges from multiple vantage points, providing unsurpassed holistic, sustainable, and innovative solutions. From high-profile, high-image landmarks to low-cost, utilitarian solutions, our professionals know how to balance image and cost appropriately for each unique situation. At Michael Baker International, we believe that the beauty of a project resides both in performance and aesthetics – “success” to us is measured by functionality, value, and exceeding clients’ expectations to “Make a Difference.” This position offers the opportunity to live and work in the great weather, mountains, and outdoor playground of Utah, and be an integral part of the Salt Lake City Michael Baker A/E team. Our team has been and is currently designing a wide array of interesting projects, including new F-35 Hangars, pilot training facilities, State Library rehabilitation, petrol-chemical facilities, and new hotels. Our multi-discipline team works together to deliver the complete package of Architecture, Civil, Structures, Mechanical, and Electrical/Communications. Our team is also executing these projects using cloud hosted B.I.M. techniques, the most innovative design and construction delivery method in use today. This process encourages collaboration within the design team and with the builder (contractor). *  DESCRIPTION *  Michael Baker International is seeking a Cybersecurity Technical Manager to join either our Midvale/Salt Lake City, Utah or Denver, Colorado office. The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic professional with responsibilities including, management, business development, design and documentation for a broad range of project types. With a current focus on growing Federal, Department of Defense, and International project opportunities, along with market-driven diversification including Healthcare, Transit, and Adaptive Re-Use, candidate will work in multi-disciplinary, collaborative project design teams with architects, interior designers, civil engineers, and building systems engineers. Candidate must demonstrate creative problem-solving, initiative to learn new concepts, organizational skills, an ability to work in a team environment with licensed electrical engineers, and a basic understanding of construction documents, facility-related Cybersecurity standards and constructability. The successful candidate will develop comprehensive Cybersecurity information and communications technology (ICT) systems designs for buildings including but not limited to telecommunications and facility related control systems. *  *   RESPONSIBILITIES *   Staff Oversight and Operational Management *    Performance Management *    Recruitment/Retention *    Resource management and utilization planning and forecasting *    Business development capabilities; ability to pursue new DoD Cybersecurity pursuits and write/support winning technical and cost proposals *    Oversee complex analysis, design, evaluation and inspection for a specific area of technical expertise which includes Cybersecurity for facility related control systems in support of project objectives *    Design, Review, and Edit project plans, specifications, and confer with other disciplines and managers to determine assistance required in plan preparation, evaluation of project conditions, design changes and reports *    Front-facing to clients. Perform client and project needs assessments, determine and discuss potential solutions, and ensure satisfactory customer service *    Prepare and present technical and program information to team members, management, and clients *    Plan and conduct the analysis, inspection, design, review, and/or integration to assure the quality of the assigned task *    Coordinate or perform field work to gather data and materials *    Perform research to support project tasks *    Review and interpret data to prepare complex analyses and reports *    Maintain a minimum of DoD 8570 IAT Level II certification and current working knowledge of government and industry Cybersecurity design criteria and standards *    Perform quality control reviews *    Create client communications and cost estimates *    Develop new approaches to solve problems identified during project/production activities *   *  PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS *  Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Information Security, or Engineering required *   10-15 years of experience in Cybersecurity related design and/or management *   5+ years direct experience specializing in DoD RMF procedures and processes desired *   Experience specializing in Government UFC, UFGS, and NIST standards highly desired *   Minimum of DoD 8570 IAT Level II approved baseline certification(s) (i.e., Security+, GSEC, SSCP, etc) required *   CISSP credential preferred but not required *   Experience with DoD Authorization to Operate (ATO) Processes and Procedures preferred *   Knowledge and experience with industry best practices, security standards, policies, and standards including NIST SP 800-53 rev4, SP 800-82 rev2, FIPS-199, FIPS-200, etc. *   Strong understanding of IT security infrastructure technologies and Facility-Related Control System technologies and functionalities. *   Detailed knowledge of Unified Facilities Criteria related to DoD is preferred *   Experience with Microsoft Office (Word/Excel) and Autodesk Revit/AutoCAD. Knowledge of Building Information Modeling (BIM) preferred *   Effective visual/verbal communication skills are essential. Candidate should possess a proficient understanding of interrelationships among design/engineering disciplines, clients, and constructors *   Solid organizational and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail *   US Citizen, eligible for security clearance *   Available for periodic travel *  COMPENSATION *  The general salary range for this position is $115,000-$138,000. This will be dependent on the experience and expertise of the incoming candidate. This role is also eligible for a discretionary bonus based upon corporate and individual performance. *  WORKPLACE FLEXIBILITY *  This is a remote position for candidates located and authorized to work in the United States.* *

Title: Business Analyst - Technology Integration Program (Remote)
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT 84119
Description: * S&P Global Corporate – Digital Technology Services * The Role: Business Analyst, DTS Integration Program * The Team: The Business Analyst for the Digital Technology Services (DTS) Integration Program works directly with the Head of DTS Integration and DTS Chief Operating Officer, supporting the overall mission and execution of the Integration Program. The role reports directly to the Head of DTS Integration and is a member of the broader Office of the CIO team. * The Impact: The role will provide program and analysis support, managing tasks and projects supporting the overall strategy and operations of the team. A successful candidate will work closely with the core program team, own multiple operational activities, and proactively ensure key program deliverables are being met. *  This role will suit a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has the ability to respond to requests with urgency, organization, and enthusiasm. Strong skills in data analysis, communication, detail-oriented, and stakeholder engagement are desired. * What’s in it for you:*  Exposure to teams and work across the entire technology organization as we partner with each service to define and execute against their integration plans * Supporting and enabling the largest program in the DTS portfolio * Autonomy to drive key priorities and responsibilities * Responsibilities:*  Analyze and summarize data sets to present to leadership as part of integration updates and decision making. Facilitate problem solving sessions with stakeholders * Manage small projects as part of the Integration Program * Weekly reporting and status communication of overall Integration Program * Coordination of agendas, presentation materials, minutes, action items/follow ups for key recurring meetings * Track and maintain the program Risk Register in partnership with the Program Managers and Head of DTS Integration * Liaise with central Integration Management Office (IMO) on any status requests or coordinating deliverables * What We’re Looking For:*  Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science, management information systems, or business with experience in technology. 3 years’ plus work experience preferred * Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills; high EQ * Experience with PowerPoint and creating visually compelling slides and graphs * Data analysis skills in Excel. Ability to summarize datasets in a clear and concise manner * Demonstrated ability to proactively plan. Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment *  Flexible Working (optional) * We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can. *  Return to Work * Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative , we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace. * Grade/Level ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 10 * The Location: Denver, CO * Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):*  S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $95,000 to $115,000. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. * In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. * This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires . * About Company Statement:*  S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape. *  ----------------------------------------------------------- *  Equal Opportunity Employer * S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. *  If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. * US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. *  ----------------------------------------------------------- 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), IFTECH202.1 - Middle Professional Tier I (EEO Job Group), SWP Priority – Ratings - (Strategic Workforce Planning) * Job ID: 272820 * Posted On: 2022-05-15 * Location: Centennial, Colorado, United States*

Title: Integrations Specialist
Description: * *  Description: *   About SOLO:*   SOLO is an industry leader in the residential solar space that specializes in creating dynamic, customizable proposals for both roofing and solar services. Started in 2018, SOLO has rapidly grown at a rate of 3x per year with no signs of slowing down. We accomplish this by delivering best-in-class operational support through our proprietary software platform that provides proposals, closing documents, CAD, and permitting products, allowing our clients to scale quickly and efficiently while improving the bottom line. Our commitment to our employees is to create a fun, upbeat environment in which creativity, dedication, and hard work can thrive. Most of all, we value your input!As an Integrations Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to implement, and maintain customer data integrations for PHX (pronounced phoenix), SOLO's SaaS product. The development team has a flat organization structure in which team members are humble and approachable; all with varying experience and strengths. As a result, a progressive learning environment is ever present as we encourage not only professional growth but personal as well.*   Job Summary:*   As an Integrations Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to implement, and maintain customer data integrations for PHX (pronounced phoenix), SOLO's SaaS product. The development team has a flat organization structure in which team members are humble and approachable; all with varying experience and strengths. As a result, a progressive learning environment is ever present as we encourage not only professional growth but personal as well.*   Duties/Responsibilities:*   Coordinate standard and custom integration projects for PHX and our clients.*    Troubleshoot and solve integration issues as they arise.*    Support our clients and Customer Success Manager.*    Concurrently work on multiple projects, and with different resolution teams and clients.*    Learn the SOLO site and processes to better service our clients.*   Compensation/Benefits:*   $40K - $60K annually DOE*    Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO).*    Healthcare Savings Account (HSA) with company match*    Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance*    Hospital and Accident Indemnity Insurance*    Short and Long Term Disability*    401K with 4% company match*    Onsite Chiropractic Adjustments, Teeth Whitening, and Gym*    Onsite, Office, and Remote Counseling and Life Coaching*    Access to Corporate Sundance Passes*    Employee Development Program*    Onsite Weekly Lunch*    Onsite Snacks and Drinks*    Onsite Professional Headshots*    Weekly Pay with the option to use On Demand Pay which allows you to be paid even sooner if you choose*    Opportunity for growth - we like to promote from within!*   . Requirements: *  Basic understanding of Zapier*    Basic understanding of API Endpoints and functionality*   Credentials and Experience:*   Associate degree in related field or equivalent work experience*    Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in API security standards and implementation as well as connections*    Ability to leverage breadth of experience and knowledge to architect and design solutions (Independently)*    Experience with or knowledge of languages and application technologies such as JavaScript, JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Extensible Markup Language (XML), web services, Application Programming Interface (API), or other languages/applications, as needed.*  *

Title: Fall VET Program: Technology Engineering Group
Description: * *  At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. *   It all begins with you. *  About these roles: *   The Veteran Employment Transition (VET) Program is a nationwide 8-week Spring and Fall internship that converts directly to a full-time opportunity based on performance. We're hiring a class of 75 - 85 interns to begin on September 12, 2022 starting with an intensive training and orientation led by professional instructors and senior Wells Fargo employees. You'll network with your peers and Wells Fargo leaders while developing your skills and knowledge of our financial products and services before joining a team of experienced Wells Fargo employees for on-the-job training and development. If you are a problem-solver who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, working hard to achieve a goal, learning new things, and improving yourself, this program might be a good fit for you. In addition, successful candidates are team-players who work well in a collaborative environment and have strong situational analysis skills. All ranks are encouraged to apply as we are hiring at multiple levels. This program is NOT DOD SkillBridge eligible as it's a Wells Fargo paid internship. *   We believe each of our employees offer something extraordinary and we consider military experience a tremendous asset to our work environment. That's why we're committed to hiring military veterans, veterans with disabilities, military families and active military Reserve and National Guard personnel. *  Program Expectations: *  Must be able to start September 12th, 2022 and attend full duration of 8-week internship program *   Must be off active duty no later than September 11th, 2022. (Only exceptions: terminal leave and/or traditional Guard or Reserve status, these are eligible) *  We are seeking military talent for our Technology Engineering Group in our Technology business in each of the cities listed below. Learn more about this line of business at https://www.wellsfargojobs.com/career-areas/ *  #VETProgram *  Required Qualifications:*   2+ years of work experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education *   Service in any branch of the United States military *   Able to work on the first day of the program, September 11, 2022*   In these roles you will: *   The Technology Engineering Group has the following opportunities: *  Data Engineer: (Available locations: Charlotte, NC; Chandler, AZ; Dallas, TX; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZ; San Antonio, TX). *  Develop database architectures to address business needs in data engineering *   Data analysis, design, and development tasks for building data pipeline into the Enterprise Data Lake (EDL) environment *   Project support for a variety of use cases in the Consumer & Small Business Banking domain *   Opportunities to work with open source toolsets such as Spark, Kafka and Hadoop in an Agile development environment *  Desired Qualifications: *  Data analysis or SQL experience*    Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills*    Development experience with Kafka, Spark, Scala*    Working with Hadoop/Big data environments*    Understanding of Process Mining/Business Process Management fundamentals*    Experience with Celonis Process Mining*    Experience with RPA (Robotic Process Automation)*    Experience with Business Intelligence reporting tools, like Tableau*   Engineering Associate: (Available locations: Charlotte, NC; Dallas, TX; Minneapolis, MN). *  Participate in the design, development, integration, testing, deployment, and support of technology solutions to complex and challenging business requirements in a variety of domains *   Develop skills in a specific domain with the help of self-paced training and mentoring from senior team members *   Support the implementation of moderate to complex projects/initiatives *   Learn and understand compliance and risk management requirements for the supported area *  Desired Qualifications:*   Analytical skills and ability to solve complex technical problems*    Knowledge of Business Intelligence/Analytics tools like Microsoft PowerBI and Tableau*    .Net or Java application development experience*    Knowledge and understanding of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle)*    Knowledge and understanding of technology object oriented: design patterns and their application*    Knowledge of Agile/Kanban practices*    Debugging experience *   Ability to learn from and interact with a diverse set of team members in a very fast paced and dynamic environment *   Knowledge and familiarity with Information Technology Infrastructure Library framework *  Lead Software Engineer: (Available locations: C harlotte, NC; New York, NY; Dallas, TX; Minneapolis, MN; Chandler, AZ; San Francisco, CA). *  Design and Implement Full Stack Java based custom tooling solutions aimed at automating and optimizing away toil *   Instantiate Site Reliability Engineering practice at Wells Fargo EFT igniting the practice, principles, and culture leading by example *   Assist in training skilled peers and partnering with peer platform embedded SRE teams *   Introduce enterprise capabilities, tools, and innovation improving availability in a multi-cloud ecosystem by evolving observability, monitoring, logging, dashboard visualization, CI/CD integration and continuous testing *   Introduce continuous improvement, standardization/automation, capabilities to conduct destructive and resiliency testing *   Introduce self-healing and autonomic capabilities solving for complex operational and systemic issues with Operations processes including customer impact, % availability of critical business flows, SLO/SLI adherence, and error budget *   Automate incident process for IT Service Operations through data Raleigh, NC and Philadelphia, PA are options but not guaranteed). *  Participate in complex technical issues and initiatives related to large scale applications, systems, databases, or other technical products and services *   Identify opportunity for process improvements within technical support strategies and plans *   Review and analyze technical queries to extract data, create standard databases, or perform limited programming to fine tune systems supporting low to medium risk technical deliverables *   Present recommendations for resolving complex technical queries *   Exercise and influence direction and outcomes *  Job Expectations: *  Ability to travel up to 10% *  Pay Rate: *  NY - New York City: $40 - $60 Hourly dependent on role*    Other pay ranges will vary based on location*   Benefits: *  Information about Wells Fargo's US employee benefits can be found here *  We Value Diversity *   At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law. *   Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. *   Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. *   Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.* *
